bibl.title: [Writ] 1778 May 12, State of No[rth] Carolina [to] Sheriff of Washington [County] / [signed by] John Sevier
bibl.note: This document is a writ issued by the state of North Carolina and signed by John Sevier on May 12, 1778. The writ orders the sheriff of Washington County to locate James Robertson and bring him forth to appear in court regarding a charge brought against him by Zachariah Isbell.

div.p:
To the Sherriff Sheriff of Washington
c et cetera , we Command you That you take the Body of James Robertson
Esqr. Esquire
if he be found Within your Bailwicke Bailiwick and him safely keep so that you have his Body before the Justices of Our Next Court to be held on the 4th Monday In may next, then and there to answer Zachariah Isbell
Esqr. Esquire
of a plea of
Tresspass Trespass on the Case to the Damage of him and said Zachariah Isbell To the sum of five Hundred pounds Herein fail not, and have you then and there this Writ Witness John Sevier Clerk of Our
Sd. Said
Court the 12th day of May
anno. Dom. Anno Domini 1778
